trans-unit.source: Contains an expression in Visual Basic syntax that evaluates to an l-value, which supports binding of the <xref href="System.Activities.ArgumentDirection.Out"></xref> arguments.
This activity uses the LINQ to Entity provider to evaluate LINQ expressions.
Any LINQ expressions used with this activity must be evaluatable by the ADO.Net Entity Data Model.
For example, LINQ expressions cannot be used to reference activities, variables, or arguments of the workflow itself.
The type of the expression.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref> class using the specific expression.
The expression string in Visual Basic syntax.
Determines whether the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref> can be converted into a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
This method always returns `true`.
The context information that is used for conversion.
`true` if the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref> can be converted into a string; otherwise `false`.
Converts the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref> to a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
The string representation consists of the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference%601.ExpressionText%2A> surrounded by brackets.
The context information that is used for conversion.
A string representation of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref>.
Gets or set the [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] expression represented by this <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference`1"></xref>.
The [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)] expression.
Gets the expression tree used in the reference.
The expression tree used in the reference.
Gets the language used in the reference.
The language used in the reference.
Gets whether the reference requires compilation.
`True` if the reference requires compilation; otherwise, `false`.
